The meaning of this verse is, the Lord of Supreme Mysticism, Yogeishvara Harihī, Shri Krishna, resides within everyone's heart as the Paramatma.
As such, just to protect the progeny of the Kuru dynasty, he covered the embryo of Uttara by his personal energy.
So what all Shri Krishna is doing?
For the sake of his devotees, he is prepared to do anything and everything to protect them.
So therefore, Shastras say, always depend on the Supreme Lord and nobody else.
Even Krishna declares in the Bhagavad Gita,
You surrender to me alone, exclusively.
Take my shelter exclusively.
Because only Krishna is dependable for everyone, for everyone.
And nobody is his enemy.
Nobody is his friend.
He is the well-wisher of everyone.
Surdam Sarvabhutana.
In the purport, Srila Prabhupada explains,
The Lord of Supreme Mysticism,
Yogeshwaro Harihi,
can simultaneously reside within everyone's heart or even within the atoms by his Paramatma feature, his plenary portion.
This Paramatma feature is a very special feature of the Supreme Lord in the material world only.
Paramatma feature is the expansion of the Lord who has entered into the heart of every living being within this material existence.
And also entered into every material atom.
So this Paramatma feature is a very, very, very special feature.
